[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'VincentTam', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-09-14 20:38:35+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "A list of sites running Staticman appears in the last section of README.  Almost _all_ of them include a link to their source code, including @username_1 's personal blog.

However, the ([Source](https://gitlab.com/username_1/username_1.gitlab.io/)) link at the right of the entry
- [username_1.me](https://username_1.me)

points to its GitLab project page, which **doesn't** show the source code generating the site.

Proposal:
1. ~([Source](https://gitlab.com/username_1/username_1.gitlab.io/))~; or
2. @username_1 publishes the source code and fixes the link.", 'title': 'A closed source website in the list of Staticman powered sites', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'zongren', 'comment_id': 421942345.0, 'datetime': '2018-09-17 09:27:47+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'I tested it in chrome private mode', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'VincentTam', 'comment_id': 421949227.0, 'datetime': '2018-09-17 09:51:39+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "@username_1 No problem :smile: Thanks for update!

I seize the chance to view your implementation of Staticman.  IMHO,

1. It's better to move site specific config (`staticman`, `recaptcha`, etc) from `themes/hexo-theme-nojs/_config.yml` to the root level site config, for example, [Beautiful Hugo][bh].  (You're more than welcome to checkout [my demo project][demo] and its source for a concrete example.)
2. `themes/hexo-theme-nojs` has better to be a Git submodule, since it's an _independent and portable_ project.  [Hugo]'s quickstart guide recommends downloading themes as Git submodules.

[bh]: https://github.com/halogenica/beautifulhugo
[demo]: https://vincenttam.gitlab.io/test-hugo-staticman/
[Hugo]: https://gohugo.io", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'closed', 'author': 'VincentTam', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-09-17 09:51:46+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'zongren', 'comment_id': 421950980.0, 'datetime': '2018-09-17 09:57:42+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'Thanks for the advice!', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'VincentTam', 'comment_id': 421952785.0, 'datetime': '2018-09-17 10:04:10+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "@username_1 You're welcome.", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: A closed source website in the list of Staticman powered sites
username_0: A list of sites running Staticman appears in the last section of README.  Almost _all_ of them include a link to their source code, including @username_1 's personal blog.

However, the ([Source](https://gitlab.com/username_1/username_1.gitlab.io/)) link at the right of the entry
- [username_1.me](https://username_1.me)

points to its GitLab project page, which **doesn't** show the source code generating the site.

Proposal:
1. ~([Source](https://gitlab.com/username_1/username_1.gitlab.io/))~; or
2. @username_1 publishes the source code and fixes the link.
<issue_comment>username_1: I tested it in chrome private mode
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 No problem :smile: Thanks for update!

I seize the chance to view your implementation of Staticman.  IMHO,

1. It's better to move site specific config (`staticman`, `recaptcha`, etc) from `themes/hexo-theme-nojs/_config.yml` to the root level site config, for example, [Beautiful Hugo][bh].  (You're more than welcome to checkout [my demo project][demo] and its source for a concrete example.)
2. `themes/hexo-theme-nojs` has better to be a Git submodule, since it's an _independent and portable_ project.  [Hugo]'s quickstart guide recommends downloading themes as Git submodules.

[bh]: https://github.com/halogenica/beautifulhugo
[demo]: https://vincenttam.gitlab.io/test-hugo-staticman/
[Hugo]: https://gohugo.io<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_1: Thanks for the advice!
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 You're welcome.

| BID-Fomin-MIF                         | Fund / Laboratory               | The Multilateral Investment Fund (MIF) is an innovation laboratory for the Inter-American Development Bank Group that engages the private sector and inspires it to solve development problems in Latin America and the Caribbean.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | http://www.fomin.org/                                 | "Latin America and the Caribbean. | Blackbox                              | Accelerator                     | "Blackbox elevates entrepreneurs everywhere. | Brain Storm Ventures                  | Venture Capital                 | Seed and early-stage venture capital firm. Managing Partner originally from Mexico.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | brainstorm.vc                                         | None                                                                                                          |

| Chilango Ventures                     | Venture Capital                 | "Chilango Ventures is a US based Venture Capital firm that has assembled an exceptional team with deep domain expertise for early stage, high return investments. Our current portfolio consists of three startups and reflects our vision for the upcoming waves of innovation. We foresee significant disruptions in the financial sector and the related ecosystem. Advances in data manipulation and machine learning are coming of age and hold the promise of fundamentally altering the practices of institutions such as banking and the role they play in trade globally. Our team has entrepreneurial experience in both the pitfalls and the opportunities in domestic as well as the international markets." | http://www.chilangoventures.com/                      | Latin America                                                                                                 | 
| Despega Talento                       | Soft-landing Services           | "Soft-landing program in Bay Area and Miami that includes connections with mentors, business partners and investors."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | www.buenosaires.gob.ar/innovacion/despegatalento      | Argentina                                                                                                     | 
| Firstrock Capital                     | Venture Capital                 | Firstrock Capital invests in tech startups that show exponential growth in the U.S. markets and that either employ or are open to recruiting engineering talent in Latin America. Firstrock Capital partner with entrepreneurs to help them recruit elite engineering teams while also removing obstacles to growth along the way.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | http://www.firstrock.vc/                              | None                                                                                                          | 
| Hackers/Founders                      | Networking Group                | Network of meetups for startup communities all around the world.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | www.hf.cx                                             | US / Latin America                                                                                            | 
| Impulsa Mexico                        | Accelerator                     | Mexican accelerator with offices in San Francisco that looks for startups that want to expand into Mexico                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | http://impulsamexico.com.mx/                          | None                                                                                                          | 
| Institute of the Americas             | Non for profit assitance        | "Non for profit organization that promotes development and integration, emphasizing the role of the private sector, as a means to improve the economic and political issues of the world"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | www.iamericas.org/en/                                 | None                                                                                                          |

| Latam Tech                            | Networking Group                | "Meetups every month where noted entrepreneurs, hackers, investors and tech people get together to discuss trends and opportunities in the convergence of tech startups, technology and Latin America"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | www.latamtechmeetup.com                               | None                                                                                                          | 
| Latin SF                              | Private-Public Partnership      | LatinSF is an initiative that promote business and trade between San Francisco and the Latin American region. Multiple local tax incentives are offered for Latin American startups that settle here and also for startups that want to expand into Latin America                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | http://sfced.org/latinsf/                             | Latin America                                                                                                 | 
| Latinas in Tech                       | Networking Group                | "Latinas in Tech is a community of women from Latin America, Brazil and Spain working in tech. The goal of this group is to connect and support with each other, while empowering our professional careers as #LatinasinTech."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | http://www.latinasintech.org/                         | "Latin America, Brazil and Spain women interested in Tech industry"                                           |

If a project fits into their target objectives it can be awarded                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | http://www.latinocf.org/                              | California                                                                                                    | 
| Latino Heritage Foundation            | Non for profit assitance        | "HHF is a nonprofit that identifies, inspires, prepares and positions Latino leaders in the classroom, community and workforce to meet America’s priorities."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | http://hispanicheritage.org/                          | None                                                                                                          | 
| Latino Startup Alliance               | Non for profit assitance        | "Promotes U.S. Latino led technology startup ventures grow by providing a strong support network of fellow entrepreneurs, investors, innovators, & mentors."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | www.latinostartupalliance.org                         | Latin America                                                                                                 | 
| LEAP Global Innovation                | Venture Capital and Advisors    | "Identifies, connects and invests in Latin American startups."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | www.leapglobalinnovation.com                          | None                                                                                                          | 
| Manos Accelerator                     | Accelerator                     | "Mentorship-driven accelerator program that provides ""hands-on"" education, business resources, infrastructure, capital, and guidance for Latino led startups"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | www.manosaccelerator.com/                             | None                                                                                                          | 
| Masschallenge                         | Accelerator                     | Masschalenge is a non for profit accelerator that gives grants to high-impact startups. They currently have an office in Mexico. Grants and cash prices range from 40k to 400k                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | http://masschallenge.org/                             | High Impact startups                                                                                          | 
| Mexican Consulate                     | Government                      | "The Mexican Consulate offers support to Mexican entrepreneurs seeking for legal advise, networking, and among others"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | https://consulmex.sre.gob.mx/sanfrancisco/            | None                                                                                                          | 
| Mexas en SF                           | Affinity Group                  | Mexas in SF is an informal group gathering Mexicans in San Francisco.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | https://www.facebook.com/groups/mexasensiliconvalley/ | San Francisco                                                                                                 | 
| Mita Ventures                         | Venture Capital                 | "VC firm that invests in early-stage technology startups in Mexico, as well as later-stage funding for proven Silicon Valley companies looking to expand into the Mexico/LatAm market."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | www.mitaventures.com                                  | None                                                                                                          | 
| Mountain Nazca                        | Venture Capital                 | "Moutain Nazca is a Latin American focused VC that was acquired by Mountain Partners AG. | Pan American Ventures                 | Fund                            | "Pan American Ventures (PAV) provides seed capital to 240 promising Mexican startups over the next four years, with as many as 80 of those startups ultimately being sent to PAV’s Austin, TX international acceleration campus to expand into the US market"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | http://panamventures.com/                             | Mexican Startups                                                                                              |

column5:
[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'unnamed42', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2020-04-27 14:46:07+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "## For feature request

I'm a plugin/theme author and I appreciate your excellent work on static blogging. 

But I find that both usage and API doc hosted on https://hexo.io are very unclear. Due to the dynamic-typed nature of Javascript, I can find little useful information on listed API function signature without being fully documented: I have no idea what argument I should pass, what type this variable is, what property this argument has, what I should return in callback. 

Also the examples provided by doc are trivial and not very helpful. I have to dig into source code or program with the power of `console.log`, to get it work.

As for the error output, once I did something wrong I can only get an exception with little useful message thrown from a deeeeeeeeeep `Promise` async call stack. If the error occurs in post rendering I can get some feedback like which line of which file (sometimes not), but I can only get `unknown error` if error occurs in script/plugin execution.

Probably I'm not able to improve error log, but I'm glad to help improving the docs. Where can I start?

中文版：
我是一个Hexo的主题和插件作者，非常感谢你们打造的博客系统。

但是我在深入的使用中发现了文档的一些问题，比如使用说明和API写的非常不清楚。由于Javascript是一门动态类型语言，所以如果不在文档中详细写明的话，从API的函数签名中我是基本找不到任何有用信息的：不知道该传入什么，不知道类型是什么，不知道属性有哪些，不知道回调该返回什么。

除此之外文档给出的例子也是，太简单，起不到什么作用。这时候就只能深入发掘源码，或者是基于`console.log`编程。

至于错误输出，只要一步做错了就只能得到抛出来的异常，一长串的调用栈，基本没有用的错误信息。如果错误是发生在帖子渲染阶段，我倒是能得到是哪个文件第几行的错误输出（也不是总有）；如果错误发生在脚本/插件执行阶段，就只能得到一个`unknown error`。

错误输出我可能是帮不了什么，不过我是很愿意帮助改进文档的。请问该从哪里开始？", 'title': 'The request for a better error message and better documentation', 'type': 'issue'}

https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/types/hexo/index.d.ts', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: The request for a better error message and better documentation
username_0: ## For feature request

I'm a plugin/theme author and I appreciate your excellent work on static blogging. 

But I find that both usage and API doc hosted on https://hexo.io are very unclear. Due to the dynamic-typed nature of Javascript, I can find little useful information on listed API function signature without being fully documented: I have no idea what argument I should pass, what type this variable is, what property this argument has, what I should return in callback. 

Also the examples provided by doc are trivial and not very helpful. I have to dig into source code or program with the power of `console.log`, to get it work.

As for the error output, once I did something wrong I can only get an exception with little useful message thrown from a deeeeeeeeeep `Promise` async call stack. If the error occurs in post rendering I can get some feedback like which line of which file (sometimes not), but I can only get `unknown error` if error occurs in script/plugin execution.

Probably I'm not able to improve error log, but I'm glad to help improving the docs. Where can I start?

中文版：
我是一个Hexo的主题和插件作者，非常感谢你们打造的博客系统。

但是我在深入的使用中发现了文档的一些问题，比如使用说明和API写的非常不清楚。由于Javascript是一门动态类型语言，所以如果不在文档中详细写明的话，从API的函数签名中我是基本找不到任何有用信息的：不知道该传入什么，不知道类型是什么，不知道属性有哪些，不知道回调该返回什么。

除此之外文档给出的例子也是，太简单，起不到什么作用。这时候就只能深入发掘源码，或者是基于`console.log`编程。

至于错误输出，只要一步做错了就只能得到抛出来的异常，一长串的调用栈，基本没有用的错误信息。如果错误是发生在帖子渲染阶段，我倒是能得到是哪个文件第几行的错误输出（也不是总有）；如果错误发生在脚本/插件执行阶段，就只能得到一个`unknown error`。

错误输出我可能是帮不了什么，不过我是很愿意帮助改进文档的。请问该从哪里开始？
<issue_comment>username_1: What helped me was reading the source code of different themes, plugins and the published types from DefinitelyTyped.

https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/types/hexo/index.d.ts
